        public static java.awt.GraphicsDevice getScreenDevice(java.awt.Rectangle bounds)
        Parameters:
        bounds - a rectangle used to find corresponding graphics device
        Returns:
        a graphics device that contains the biggest part of the specified rectangle

      • isStandardAddRemoveNotify

        public static boolean isStandardAddRemoveNotify(java.awt.Component component)
        Method removeNotify (and then addNotify) will be invoked for all components when main frame switches between states "Normal" <-> "FullScreen". In this case we shouldn't call Disposer in removeNotify and/or release some resources that we won't initialize again in addNotify (e.g. listeners).

      • getScreenInsets

        public static java.awt.Insets getScreenInsets(java.awt.GraphicsConfiguration gc)

      • getScreenRectangle

        public static java.awt.Rectangle getScreenRectangle(java.awt.GraphicsConfiguration configuration)
        Returns a visible area for the specified graphics configuration.
        Parameters:
        configuration - one of available configurations
        Returns:
        a visible area rectangle

      • getScreenRectangle

        public static java.awt.Rectangle getScreenRectangle(int x,
                                                    int y)
        Returns a visible area for a graphics device that is the closest to the specified point.
        Parameters:
        x - the X coordinate of the specified point
        y - the Y coordinate of the specified point
        Returns:
        a visible area rectangle

      • moveRectangleToFitTheScreen

      • fitToScreenVertical

        public static void fitToScreenVertical(java.awt.Rectangle rectangle,
                                       int top,
                                       int bottom,
                                       boolean rightAligned)
        Finds the best place for the specified rectangle on the screen.
        Parameters:
        rectangle - the rectangle to move and resize
        top - preferred offset between rectangle.y and popup above
        bottom - preferred offset between rectangle.y and popup below
        rightAligned - shows that the rectangle should be moved to the left

      • fitToScreen

        public static void fitToScreen(java.awt.Rectangle r)

      • isMovementTowards

        public static boolean isMovementTowards(java.awt.Point prevLocation,
                                        java.awt.Point location,
                                        java.awt.Rectangle bounds)
        Parameters:
        prevLocation - - previous location on screen
        location - - current location on screen
        bounds - - area to check if location shifted towards or not. Also in screen coordinates
        Returns:
        true if movement from prevLocation to location is towards specified rectangular area
